Usage Policy

Green Button Third Party Data Usage Guidelines

1. Data Collection and Use

As a Green Button Third Party, we collect and use energy usage data only with explicit customer authorization and for the following purposes:

  • Providing energy efficiency recommendations
  • Analyzing usage patterns to help customers reduce costs
  • Generating reports and visualizations of energy consumption
  • Enabling integration with third-party energy management systems

2. Data Protection

We implement industry-standard security measures to protect your energy data:

  • Encryption of data in transit and at rest
  • Secure OAuth2 authentication protocols
  • Access controls and audit logging
  • Regular security assessments and updates

3. Data Sharing

Your energy usage data is never shared with third parties without your explicit consent, except:

  • When required by law or legal process
  • For technical support purposes (with anonymized data)
  • With your explicit written permission

4. Data Retention

Energy usage data is retained only as long as necessary to provide services to you:

  • Active customer data: retained while service is active
  • Historical data: retained for 7 years for analysis purposes
  • Anonymized aggregated data: may be retained indefinitely for research

5. Customer Rights

As a customer, you have the right to:

  • Access your data at any time
  • Request correction of inaccurate data
  • Request deletion of your data
  • Withdraw consent for data processing
  • Export your data in a standard format

6. Compliance

This implementation complies with:

  • Green Button standard (NAESB REQ.21)
  • OAuth2 and OpenID Connect specifications
  • Industry data protection best practices

7. Contact

For questions about this usage policy, contact: support@greenbuttonalliance.org
